fields.description: In FishEye 1.x, it was easy to see what date and time people had checked in code and in 2.0 this is very hard. When the date is displayed for all checkins prior to the current day, all we see is the date and no time.

  <con:license ...

We should use the option that does NOT add a con: prefix

fields.description:
We are running the FishEye/Crucible 2.0 beta3 in our staging environment, integrated with the Crowd 2.0 beta for user management.

Because it was a test environment, I only put 2 or 3 users into Crowd.  This meant that any files/changesets in Subversion checked in by those users shows their full name in FishEye when browsing the repositories and files/changesets submitted by other users just shows their username.

While testing the "following" features, I noticed something strange.  If I click the "star" next to a file that was submitted by a user in Crowd, the Activity tab on my Dashboard shows their full name as expected.  If I click the "star" next to a file submitted by a non-Crowd user, it shows "my" name next to the file in the Activity stream.

I've attached 2 screenshots.  In screenshot1, you see the activity on the file by user "jxv96".  After clicking the star above the activity and browsing back to my Dashboard, you see the resulting screenshot2 showing that the activity belongs to me - both are referring to changeset 7456.  If I click the link to go back to that changeset, the ownership is still listed as jxv96.  The mixed up mapping seems to only happen on the dashboard.
fields.summary: User mapping problem in FishEye beta

fields.description:
The README.html file could be the first time that someone is reading documentation, so let's make sure that we have content in there to address the needs of evaluators, installers and upgraders.

I'd recommend adding the following content:

FishEye Evaluators (header formatted)
Follow the [Evaluator Guide|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFEVAL/FishEye+Evaluator+Resources]

New FishEye Installations (header formatted)
Follow the [Installation Guide|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/FishEye+Installation+Guide]

Uprading Fisheye (header formatted)
Follow the [Upgrade Guide| http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/FishEye+Upgrade+Guide

Release Notes (header formatted)
Current and previous release notes are available [here|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/FishEye+Release+Notes]

I think we can remove the following links:

An introduction to Crucible can be found here: http://www.atlassian.com/software/crucible/features/   (This is marketing content, which presumably has done it's job by now ;) )

Reference documentation for Crucible can be found here: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE/  (We're already linking to three appropriate subsections of the crucible documentation, so this is probably uneccessary)
fields.summary: Enhance README.html to include links to Evaluator Guide, Installation Guide, and Upgrade Guide

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1) Download FishEye 2.0 RC1 via http://www.atlassian.com/software/fisheye/beta/
2) Unzip the archive
3) Open the README.html file
OBSERVE:
This is the crucible readme.html
EXPECTED:
FishEye readme.html
fields.summary: FishEye RC1 tarball contains Readme.HTML that links to Crucible docs

fields.description:
EQL is very powerful for finding sets of code that have changed, and reporting metrics on amount of change.
It does not allow for simple summary of the discovered numbers.
If I could do a SUM over the returned set of lines added or removed, that would allow me to provide high level status quickly.
Operators of interest:
COUNT
SUM
AVERAGE
fields.summary: EyeQL Summary operators

Report decorator should show breadcrumbs

fields.description: http://skitch.com/prutser/bijda/erik-van-zijst-home
fields.summary: JIRA change aggregation shows same issue id twice when two files attached to the same issue

fields.description:
Report plugins currently can optionally take a path, but once you are viewing the report there is no way to change the path. 

Whilst it is trivial to add a tree to the decorator there are some complications:

* only render trees where the plugin can handle a path 
* only show the nodes in the tree that the plugin can handle (e.g. code metrics only works on directories)
* only show reports that are relevant to the current node type in the toolbar
* handle breadcrumbs properly
* others ... see tim
fields.summary: Report plugins should handle paths better

fields.description: http://img.skitch.com/20090624-ft6y6c7ieahastw8byqqf8xwt6.jpg

fields.description: Where we currently toggle the type of activity (either all, commits, reviews, issues) it should be checkboxes so you can select one or more types of activity. see screenshot.
fields.summary: Stream type selection to use checkboxes instead of toggle

fields.description:
After I deleted all repositories (running eac demotion) and added the sanity1 svn repo through the admin interface and started a "wget --mirror" (visiting every link it finds), I ran into what seems like an infinite loop in charting.

url: /crucible/fe/locChart.do?w=276&h=200&context=user&markEnd=0&markStart=0&username=evzijst&imageBackgroundColour=FFFFFF&outputtype=image

It loops forever in CalculatedBucketGraphXY.calculateDates()
fields.summary: Infinite loop in CalculatedBucketGraphXY

fields.description:
Occasionally people edit Subversion commit logs ('svn propset --revprop -r 123 svn:log "blah"). It would be nice if Fisheye could pick up such changes without a complete reindex.

Perhaps the best way to do this would be to create a REST call that triggers the reindex of a particular revision.  This can then be called via wget/curl in the pre-revprop-change hook.
fields.summary: Handle log message rewriting

fields.description: For the new changeset api to assist the JIRA plugin
fields.summary: Add p4 Jobs Fixed info to the changeset lucene index
Deleted SVN revisions don't have the properties the previous revision had, in particular the mime type is lost

fields.description: resizing the window fixes this. it just annoying.
fields.summary: Resizing a window when a page loads causes contents at bottom of page to be hidden.

fields.description:
As the repositories are sorted by last modification, it is likely that the order and membership of the repositories in a QuickSearch will change while a user is moving through pages.

To fix this, the set of repositories (and their ordering) should be included in the second and subsequent request for a results page.

Created from crucible comment by Adrian Hempel: https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/cru/CR-FE-2025#c18428
fields.summary: Cross-repo QS repository membership and ordering changes between pages

fields.description:
In IE browser, we can only see the latest changes in Fisheye until we refresh the browser manually. This doesn't happen in Firefox browser.

Steps to reproduce:
# Do a file commit e.g commit a change in svn repo
# Go to Administration > Repository List > View (next to repo) > Indexer > Maintenance > Scan now, do an incremental scan
# When the scanning process has finished
# Go to Administration > Repository List > View (next to repo) > Browse, to see the latest changeset
# You won't see the latest changeset until the browser is refreshed
fields.summary: Not able to see the latest revision in Fisheye until the IE browser is refreshed

fields.description:
The links in the menu for one option aren't including the variables for the other option

you can get the url by hacking (3 lines of context, ignore all whitespace):
context/browse/repo/path/to/file.java?r1=1&r2=2&u=-1&ignore=w

the link to "10 lines of context" is:
context/browse/repo/path/to/file.java?r1=1&r2=2&u=10

the link to "ignore significant whitespace" is 
context/browse/repo/path/to/file.java?r1=1&r2=2&ignore=b
fields.summary: In diff view, selecting a context clears any ignore settings, and vice versa

fields.description:
If you reassign the JIRA to me I'll add in the IE7 options that Nic and I worked on for opacity replacement in the Crucible file tree. 

We ran in to this issue:
http://snook.ca/archives/html_and_css/ie-position-fixed-opacity-filter#c63530

Created from crucible comment by Peter Moore: https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/cru/CR-FE-2075#c18292
fields.summary: IE fix for use of opacity

fields.description:
restoring a large backup (in the order of 1.5gigs) cause an Out of Memory Error, see this bug report http://bugs.sun.com/bugdatabase/view_bug.do?bug_id=4705373

stack trace:
{code}
[echo] Restoring to /Users/jxie/dev/repos/local-pg: restore -f /Users/jxie/dev/repos/local-pg.zip -t postgresql -u crucible -p crucible -j jdbc:postgresql://localhost:5432/crucible
     [java] ERROR: problem running command
     [java] java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
     [java]     at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
     [java]     at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
     [java]     at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
     [java]     at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:585)
     [java]     at com.cenqua.fisheye.FishEyeCtl.mainImpl(FishEyeCtl.java:106)
     [java]     at com.cenqua.fisheye.FishEyeCtl.main(FishEyeCtl.java:39)
     [java] Caused by: java.lang.OutOfMemoryError
     [java]     at java.util.zip.ZipFile.open(Native Method)
     [java]     at java.util.zip.ZipFile.<init>(ZipFile.java:203)
     [java]     at java.util.zip.ZipFile.<init>(ZipFile.java:84)
     [java]     at com.cenqua.fisheye.ctl.Restore.run(Restore.java:90)
     [java]     at com.cenqua.fisheye.ctl.Restore.main(Restore.java:185)
     [java]     ... 6 more
     [java] Java Result: 1
{code}
fields.summary: restoring a backup that is large causes an Out of Memory Error

fields.description:
steps to reproduce:
1. go to the browse view
2. make sure show deleted files is off (that is, should not be able to see deleted files)
3. click on a directory node which you know have deleted files
result: the deleted file is displayed despite the setting.

screenshot:
----
!http://img.skitch.com/20090619-83ee8b7iyqabfdktgpgdms2i1m.png!

fields.description:
To reproduce:

1. Go to the activity stream.
2. Click the 'Show Revisons' tick box at the top.
3. Mouse over the gear/cog menu for a changeset

Expected
- Icons remain in place

Actual
- Icons shift as soon as you mouse over the gear/cog icon.
fields.summary: Activity stream icons move when mousing over menu (IE7)
